headline: Why Old Industrial Lofts Draw Shiny New Tech Firms
abstract: A generation of workers is rejecting cookie-cutter office space, opting instead for the manufacturing lofts that once defined New York City.
lead_paragraph: A century-old loft building has been retrofitted for tech workers with fancy pantries, bleacher seating for all-hands meetings and a library for Kindle readers where the only books are decorations on the wallpaper.
